job_title: Administrative in Rockville Centre, NY
pros: People and students are kind. The campus has nice qualities too it. The mission is wonderful. Good benefits and time off.

review_title: Horrible. Business Depart. shows extreme favoritism.
job_title: Instructor in Rockville Centre, NY
pros: Small College and the overall environment is extremely pleasant.  Departments help one another. While the salary isn't the best, the benefits and overall environment make up the difference.
cons: The Business Department is deplorable. The favoritism exhibited by the new Dean and his associates is sickening. Everyone is either with the banking industry or was with the banking industry and solely for this reason the Finance field is strongly promoted.

job_title: Adjunct in Rockville Centre, NY
pros: Students at Molloy joke that they have to be nice in order to get in no matter what their SAT scores may be.  In fact, the students ARE delightful, and the staff is as well. The campus is safe, secure, and the quality of the education offered is as solid, and in some cases even better,  as any of its competition on Long Island.
cons: Adjunct salary is pretty low and stagnant.

review_title: good place to work for - no growth opportunities

job_title: Associate Professor in Rockville Centre, NY
pros: The student body is very polite and a pleasure to teach, though extremely sheltered - undergraduates mostly sourced from local Catholic Schools.  Co-workers are nice, most work there for the no-stress lifestyle.
cons: The environment is parochial and outdated, which is a shame given the location so close to NYC.  Performance is measured on the number of meetings attended, as opposed to value added in education.  The graduate MBA program is a challenge to facilitate.   No GMAT requirement leaves the professors having to teach middle school concepts.
